## How to: Invitation to Yoda collaboration
After you are added to a Yoda group by the admin or a colleague you will receive an invitation to join a Yoda “collaboration” in SRAM (SURF Research Access Management). The “join” link in the invitation will lead you to SRAM.
[SRAM invitations] Hier komt afbeedling (4 & 5)

•	If you have not logged in to SRAM before with your browser, you will see the following screen where you can search for your institute:
[SRAM login page] Hier komt afbeedling (6)

1.	If your institute is included in this list and if you are affiliated with a research or education organisation you can choose your institution name which will redirect you to your familiar institutional login page.
2.	If your institute is not in this list or if you are not affiliated with a research or education organisation please choose **eduID** (NL). If you do not yet have an eduID you can create one for free, the system will lead you through the process. More information on eduID here: https://www.eduid.nl/
[SRAM login with eduID ] Hier komt afbeelding (7)
3.	When logged in you will be shown a welcome screen in SRAM, click proceed to accept the invitation.
4.	Now click the “Open” button to go to the Yoda portal.


## How to: Creating eduID  
1.  After choosing eduID (NL) you can fill in the email address to create a new eduID account. 
[Creating a new account eduID] Hier komt afbeelding (8 & 9)
2.	After requesting the account, an email is sent to your inbox to verify your eduID account. Please note that the email doesn’t always appear in the inbox folder and may be forwarded to your spam folder.
3.	In order to proceed to Yoda Portal succsefuly, the eduID app is needed which can be downloaded and installed on any phone device.
[Installing eduID app] Hier komt afbeelding (10)
4.	After setting up the app you can proceed to scan the QR code with your app.
[scanning QR code] Hier komt afbeelding (11)
5.	If you wish to set up a recovery method, you can proceed to add a phone number.
[Setting up a recovery method] (12)
